entry.title: Combined summary - [BIP Proposal] Reduced Data Temporary Softfork
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around the proposal for a temporary soft fork within Bitcoin Core v30, as outlined in [luke-jr's ML proposal](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/2017), which has been uncontested for three weeks. The primary aim of this proposal is to emphasize that bitcoin should be viewed and used as money rather than a platform for data storage. This is suggested to be achieved through consensus by limiting arbitrary data at the consensus level, with the soft fork set to expire after one year. This period is intended to provide a window for developing a more permanent solution. The activation of this soft fork can proceed in one of two ways: proactive or reactive, though there is an acknowledgment of a tight timeline for its implementation. Criticism and concerns have been voiced regarding the proposal. These include technical issues as well as broader implications of enforcing compliance among miners and other network participants through legal and moral frameworks, which some see as problematic. The resistance suggests a division among community members over the approach and principles behind the proposed changes. Additionally, transaction 8e2ee13d2a19951c2777bb3a54f0cb69a2f76dae8baa954cd86149ed1138cb6c was mentioned as containing the full text of the BIP, demonstrating compliance with the proposal. However, the effectiveness of this strategy has been questioned, indicating skepticism about the proposal's practicality or its ability to achieve the intended outcomes. Overall, the discourse highlights a mix of support and contention surrounding the proposal to redefine the use of bitcoin through a temporary soft fork, reflecting diverse perspectives on the future direction and governance of the Bitcoin network.
